item.title: 235 – Steelhead Falls
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Steelhead Falls So many fine-boned bodies lined up, ready to hurl themselves into the silver cascade crashing blue-green I thought of the trout of your slim body, perfect pearl eye, rainbow slick-scaled and shining That was years ago when we … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Steelhead Falls

So many fine-boned bodies
lined up, ready
to hurl themselves into the silver
cascade crashing blue-green

I thought of the trout
of your slim body, perfect
pearl eye, rainbow slick-scaled
and shining

That was years ago
when we knew the lingo
of the cove, secret society
lingering on the edge, leaping

We have lept

We know the jagged shoals
dark pull of the current
we fight in our own ways
together, sheltered behind the rock

item.title: 234 – Tent
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Tent I built the tent in the dark put my breath into the ThermRest laid out your sleeping bag while you wept by the fire I woke in the night, afraid you’d stumbled off without a light that you’d lose … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Tent

I built the tent in the dark
put my breath into the ThermRest
laid out your sleeping bag
while you wept by the fire

I woke in the night, afraid
you’d stumbled off without a light
that you’d lose your way
and fall alone

I reached out a hand
into the empty space
between us
not for the last time

item.title: 233 – Hwy 126 E
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Hwy 126 E We’re provisioned: whiskey and Slim Jims The sun’s setting too fast We’re driving into the dark heart of the unknown
item.content:encoded:
Hwy 126 E

We’re provisioned: whiskey and Slim Jims

The sun’s setting too fast

We’re driving into the dark

heart of the unknown

item.title: 232 – Fixed
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Fixed Christ said there’s a great gulf fixed and some days I wonder if this is it though for the life of me I can’t figure just quite what he meant by fixed and some days that’s the only thing … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Fixed

Christ said there’s a great gulf fixed

and some days I wonder if this is it

though for the life of me I can’t figure

just quite what he meant by fixed

and some days that’s the only thing I’ve got

item.title: 231 – Pythagoras of the Plain
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Pythagoras of the Plain the half-lidded moon tips over drunkenly covering the fields until the rabbits turn silver and the crickets quiet their bows the shocks of wheat tired of dancing list on flimsy elbows to drink in the light … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Pythagoras of the Plain

the half-lidded moon
tips over drunkenly
covering the fields
until the rabbits turn silver
and the crickets quiet
their bows

the shocks of wheat
tired of dancing
list on flimsy elbows
to drink in the light
each one dragging out
a sharp hypotenuse of shadow
behind

(inspirado por FGL)

item.title: 230 – A Little Extra Amber
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: A Little Extra Amber Stay for a bit of conversation, won’t you, sit down, stretch your legs, let rush hour traffic ease up. You’re young, you’ve got time! Pour yourself a Scotch and top mine off while you’re at it. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
A Little Extra Amber

Stay for a bit of conversation, won’t you, sit down,
stretch your legs, let rush hour traffic ease up. You’re young,
you’ve got time! Pour yourself a Scotch and top mine off
while you’re at it. Not too much now! Since you’re here,
I have a bird feeder needs hanging. The light’s lovely
isn’t it? I just love late summer, August burning down
at both ends. Damn if this poor boy isn’t a mess tonight,
hurling grapefruit, pure trash, I swear. Walked six batters
in four innings, I don’t know why they keep him. Lord
we need a win. How’s your wife? Still pretty as ever?
Good good. That was me once, years ago. Oh stop
you’re a damned liar, but I can’t curse you
for trying. Dribble a little in there, honey. That’saboy.
No, the knees are connected to the hipbone
to the low back and the eyesight and p’etty soon
it’s all shot. But I’m still kicking, honey, still hoot-tootin’
around. How’s that brother of yours? He call you?
Never calls me. That’s alright, he’s busy. They’re all busy.
Your uncles’re spread so wide, I’ve got a boy in every port.
Hoo! Not bad for an 80-year-old lady. Not bad. Look at that
light, like the LORD might just come back today, could be.
One of these days, soon. I can feel it. You get to be my age
it comes like a bum knee tingling with the rain: the LORD
has plans, He touches the top of your head when you’re not looking, boy,
just to remind you: heads up, buster. Remember who’s in charge.
Ha. I remember–plentya things I can’t find in this old basket of mine,
but that one I know. Who’s in charge? Not this old bird. Not anymore.
Oh, there I go again. You’re too sweet. Thank you, honey, thank you.
Are you? I see, I see. Well, top me off before you go,
a little extra amber never hurt a soul. Amiright?
Love you too. Love all of you too damn much.

item.title: 229 – Apricots
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Apricots Too long in the paper sack Fruit flies cloud my hand Where do they come from? Knife sinks easy spilling syrupy flesh Glances the brained pit Bright lurking shard Bites my sticky slippery hand Divining a new line in … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Apricots

Too long in the paper sack

Fruit flies cloud my hand

Where do they come from?

Knife sinks easy spilling syrupy flesh

Glances the brained pit

Bright lurking shard

Bites my sticky slippery hand

Divining a new line in the palm

The cut cannot be undone

Blood mixes with syrup magenta

Pools spills its stain into the white sink

A jalopied ceiling fan turns and turns

item.title: 228 – Love Cat
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Love Cat She’s silent until she cries to be fed. She eats greedily. She publicly licks herself in the most awkward places. She cannot be approached directly but must be lured, coaxed. She often looks surprised or guilty or both. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Love Cat

She’s silent until she cries
to be fed. She eats greedily.

She publicly licks herself
in the most awkward places.

She cannot be approached directly
but must be lured, coaxed.

She often looks surprised or guilty
or both.

She comes to us on her own terms.

She makes us yell and curse
and at our worst we swat at her,
wish her dead and taxidermied.

She always comes back.

She’ll vomit up blood; she’ll kill a bird
for us.

She growls low to warn; she uses her claws when necessary.

She swirls around our legs and hands,
butting up, not taking no for an answer.

She invades our space.

She rests on our chests and matches heartbeats.

She races around the house for no reason.

She looks at us as if we’re stupid, as if she feels sorry
that we don’t quite get her.

She sheds as easily as breathing. We find her everywhere.

item.title: 227 – building an altar
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: building an altar skin rises up like the LORD said man ought to do: fumble in the dirt you come from & make me plain & simple an altar don’t want gold or silver and work no stone with tools … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
building an altar

skin rises up like the LORD said man
ought to do: fumble in the dirt
you come from & make me plain
& simple an altar don’t want gold
or silver and work no stone with tools
turned to idols just the earth
I made to make memory of me
who you can’t see, so said the LORD

& I have heard & believed but also turned
myself into the cut stone a bodied altar
inked & scarred so (perhaps) unholy
carrying the divine heart on my sleeves
an altar still carven in the dust
I am made from dust that bleeds
that will return to blood one day
leaving the memory & dirt
plain & simple, mounded high

item.title: 226 – Brown
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Brown flash flood fists brown glass broken teeth rain down on shoulders head drown the other in blows take cover white boy stay away white boy don’t say you saw what you think you saw
item.content:encoded:
Brown

flash flood
fists brown
glass broken
teeth rain down
on shoulders head
drown
the other
in blows

take cover
white boy
stay away
white boy
don’t say
you saw
what you think
you saw
